TaxonIdentification.species_authority: (Nuttall) D. R. Morgan & R. L. Hartman

treatment.description: Plants tufted, 10–35 cm. Leaves evenly distributed along stems, margins usually ciliate, sometimes spinulose-dentate, bristles usually 0.5–1.5 mm. Heads 1 or often 2–5. Peduncles 0.5–2 cm, often bracteate to proximal to heads. 2n = 8.
treatment.habitat: gypseous or sandy plains or badlands
treatment.discussion: Variety grindeloides is known to hybridize with Xanthisma coloradoense in southern Wyoming.
